Column Comment.0: JURISDICTION: The unique identifier for the business associate (regulator orjurisdiction) who is responsible for the land sale.
Column Comment.1: LAND SALE NUMBER: A unique identifier for the land sale
Column Comment.2: LAND SALE OFFERING ID: Unique identifier for the land sale offering.
Column Comment.3: LAND OFFERING BID: Unique identifier for a bid. Within the bid, individualcomponents may be sequenced using PRIORITY ORDER. This enables grouped,contingent, sliding and other types of grouped bids to be tracked.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: ADDRESS FOR SERVICE: The address for service used for this land bid.
Column Comment.6: ADDRESS OBSERVATION NUMBER: A number used to uniquely identifying anaddress for a Business Associate.
Column Comment.7: ADDRESS SOURCE: The source of the BA Address used.
Column Comment.8: BIDDER: the identifier for the Business Associate who has submitted the bid.
Column Comment.9: R LAND BIDDER TYPE: he type of bidder, such as third party broker, self, partner.
Column Comment.10: R LAND BID STATUS: The current status of the bid, such as pending, successful,unsucessful etc.
Column Comment.11: BID STATUS DATE: the date that the status indicated in the BID STATUS columnwas effective.
Column Comment.12: BID SUBMITTED DATE: the date that the bid was submitted.
Column Comment.13: R LAND BID TYPE: The type of bid that has been submitted. May be sliding scale,grouped, straight.
Column Comment.14: CASH BID TYPE: The type of cash bid. This is used to determine the method used toprocess the complete bid. May be a sliding scale bid, group bid... In a sliding scalebid, bids are placed on parcels in order of importance - if the first priority bid isaccepted, the second bid may or may not be considered (depending on whether thebid is contingent on acceptance). In a grouped bid, all parcels with the same prioritymust be accepted or rejected together. Not to be used for Work bids.
Column Comment.15: CONFIDENTIAL_IND: Indicates that a bid is confidential, usually done through abroker.
Column Comment.16: CONTINGENCY DESCRIPTION: A textual description of the type of contingencyplaced on processing the bids.
Column Comment.17: CONTINGENCY INDICATOR: If set to yes, the bids next in the priority order are tobe considered when the current level is accepted. If set to no, the next priority level isconsidered regardelss of the success of the current level.
Column Comment.18: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.19: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.20: PAYMENT INSTRUCTION ID: unique identifier for the payment instructions.
Column Comment.21: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.22: PRIORITY SEQUENCE NUMBER: the priority of the bid seqence for that bid. Theremay be more than one priority number 1, but each will relate to a different land saleoffering.
Column Comment.23: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.24: RESPONSE: details of the lessors response to the bid offering.
Column Comment.25: RESPONSE DATE: The date that the lessor responded to the bid offering.
Column Comment.26: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.27: SUCCESSFUL INDICATOR: indicates whether the bid component was accepted.
Column Comment.28: WORK BID INDICATOR: A flag indicating that the bid is a work bid. Work bidscontain promises to complete a certain amount of work or to spend a specifiedamount of money in land development.
Column Comment.29: WORK BID REMARK: contains a detailed description of the work committmentincluded in the bid. If the bid is successful, and the land is acquired, this field shouldbe copied directly into a corresponding row inLR_OBLIGATION.WORK_OBLIGATION_REMARK.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.31: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.33: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.36: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
